dmca.title: Win Friends, But Only After You Pay
dmca.body:
Dear Ms. [Recipient], 

It has come to our attention that you are currently advertising on the About.com website with an article entitled "[masked]".  You article quotes Dale Carnegie, as well as lists several of Mr. Carnegie's tips listed in the Golden Book he authored. 

Mr. Carnegie's literary works have all be registered with the U.S. Copyright Office, which makes your article a violation of our registered material(s). 
Any and all discussions or articles regarding the techniques taught by Dale Carnegie Training? are taught solely by our authorized, licensed franchise locations.  You and your organization are not now, and have at no time, been authorized to use any material, quotes or reference any protected documents relating to Dale Carnegie Training?.   

Therefore, we request that the above referenced article you are currently advertising on About.com relating to Dale Carnegie and/or his registered works be removed immediately or we will have no choice but to pursue legal action. 

Sincerely,

[Sender]
Paralegal
Dale Carnegie & Associates, Inc.
